description: smiling little boy wearing a sweater and shorts, walking down street carrying two bottles of wine; other children and walking figures in background at left
inscription:
Signature, Inscription and Stamp

on back, in pencil: [HCB - 1405] and [PF62844]
markings: LLC, impressed in paper: [(C) HENRI / CARTIER / BRESSON]
signed: LRC below image, in black ink: [Henri Cartier-Bresson]
text: Photojournalist Henri Cartier-Bresson was among the most influential street photographers of the twentieth century. Known for his candid photographs of everyday life around the globe, he wrote that “the camera is a sketch book, an instrument of intuition and spontaneity.” His photograph of a boy toting bottles of wine along a Parisian street provides immediate insight into the child’s impish good humor as he goes about an ordinary neighborhood errand.
title: Rue Moffetard
